meanings.sent1: After losing the race, he decided to repursue the championship next year.
meanings.sent2: She is repursuing her dream of becoming a doctor after taking a break.
meanings.sent3: The detective had to repursue the suspect after losing sight of him in the crowd.
meanings.sent4: Like a determined hunter, he repursued his target until he finally caught it.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's coach encouraged him to repursue his training with even more dedication.

meanings.sent1: Her repursuing of the thief led to his capture by the police.
meanings.sent2: The repursuing of her lost dog ended happily when he was found in the park.
meanings.sent3: The repursuing of the treasure hunt brought excitement to the group of friends.
meanings.sent4: The repursuing of her childhood dream brought a sense of fulfillment to her life.
meanings.sent5: The repursuing of the investigation revealed new clues that solved the mystery.
